snippet: The government and opposition issued a joint list of demands that could pave the way for the reopening of NATO supply lines there.
abstract: Pakistani government and opposition join to present the United States with list of stringent demands that could pave the way for reopening of NATO supply lines through the country; analysts say the resolution signals a new, more pragmatic chapter in relations between the two countries.

byline.original: By SALMAN MASOOD and DECLAN WALSH

lead_paragraph: The government and opposition issued a joint list of demands that could pave the way for the reopening of NATO supply lines there.

headline.seo: Pakistan Demands an End to C.I.A. Drone Strikes
headline.main: Pakistan Gives U.S. a List of Demands, Including an End to C.I.A. Drone Strikes
headline.print_headline: Pakistan Gives U.S. a List of Demands, Including an End to C.I.A. Drone Strikes

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
